npc_2.question: How do I change the skin of an NPC in Minecraft?
npc_2.reference_answer: Left-click on the skin you want in the NPC menu to change it. There are 60 skins available, and the default is the yellow-robed NPC.
npc_2.model_answer:
To change the skin of an NPC in Minecraft, you can follow these steps:

1. Open the game and go to the world where the NPC is located.
2. Right-click on the NPC to open its dialogue box.
3. In the dialogue box, click on the "Skin" option.
4. A list of available skins will appear. You can select a skin from this list by clicking on it.
5. Once you have selected a new skin for the NPC, click on the "Apply" button to save your changes.

Alternatively, if you want to change the skin of an NPC using its spawn egg, you can follow these steps:

1. Open the game and go to the world where the NPC is located.
2. Find the spawn egg of the NPC that you want to change the skin of.
3. Right-click on the spawn egg to open its menu.
4. Select the "Skin" option from the menu.
5. A list of available skins will appear. You can select a skin from this list by clicking on it.
6. Once you have selected a new skin for the NPC, click on the "Apply" button to save your changes.

Note that changing the skin of an NPC using its spawn egg will only change the skin of the specific NPC instance that is spawned from the spawn egg. It will not change the default skin of all NPCs in the game world.

tutorialredstone_computers_6.question: How do I make a computer work in Minecraft?

To make a computer work in Minecraft, you need to design and build the computer using redstone components.

Here are some general steps to help you get started:

1.  Plan your computer's architecture: Determine how many bits your computer will have (e.g., 8-bit or 16-bit). This will affect the number of redstone dust blocks, repeaters, and other components needed.
2.  Build the memory and address decoders: These are essential components that allow the computer to store and retrieve data from its memory.
3.  Create the arithmetic logic unit (ALU): The ALU is responsible for performing arithmetic and logical operations on data stored in the computer's memory.
4.  Implement the instruction set and machine architecture: This involves defining how the computer will execute instructions, including how it will fetch and decode instructions, perform arithmetic and logical operations, and store results in its memory.

These are general steps to help you get started with building a computer in Minecraft using redstone components.

diamond.question: How do I get extra diamonds from diamond ore?
diamond.reference_answer: Use a Fortune-enchanted pickaxe to get up to 4 diamonds per ore with Fortune III. Silk Touch drops the ore block instead.
diamond.model_answer:
To get extra diamonds from diamond ore, you can use the Fortune enchantment on your pickaxe. 

Fortune I gives a chance for 2 diamonds, averaging 1.33 diamonds.
Fortune II gives a 25% chance (each) to give 2 or 3 diamonds, averaging 1.75 diamonds.
Fortune III gives a 20% chance (each) to give 2, 3, or 4 diamonds, averaging 2.2 diamonds.

Using Fortune on your pickaxe can increase the number of diamonds dropped from diamond ore.

elytra_1.question: How do I get an elytra in Minecraft?
elytra_1.reference_answer: You find elytra in end ships in the End, guarded by a shulker. They're in item frames in the treasure room, so you'll need to break the frame to collect it.
elytra_1.model_answer:
To get an elytra in Minecraft, you need to find one in an end ship. End ships are located in the outer islands of The End.

When you find an end ship, you can enter it and navigate through its rooms until you reach the treasure room. In this room, you'll often find a shulker guarding a collection of elytra and other valuable items.

Once you've found an elytra, you can equip it in your chestplate slot to start gliding with it.

heart_pottery_sherd.question: How do I get heart pottery sherds in Minecraft?

heart_pottery_sherd.model_answer: You can find heart pottery sherds in trail ruins. When you break a decorated pot, it will drop all the bricks and pottery sherds used to craft it. This means that if you used heart pottery sherds to craft the decorated pot, breaking it will cause it to drop heart pottery sherds.

structure_block_5.question: What do the different chest types in shipwrecks hold?
structure_block_5.reference_answer: The map chest has navigation items, the treasure chest has gold and valuable loot, and the supply chest has basic supplies like food and tools.
structure_block_5.model_answer:
In shipwrecks, the different chest types hold random loot. The three types of chests are:

1. Supply Chest: This chest generates in the bow (front) of the ship.
2. Map Chest: This chest generates in the lower section of the stern (rear).
3. Treasure Chest: This chest generates in the upper section of the stern.

Each chest type can hold a maximum of 27 items, depending on the rotation and intact sections of the ship.
